tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE stress_test_scenarios (
    scenario_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    scenario_name TEXT,
    estimated_loss DECIMAL,
    stress_level INT
)

CREATE TABLE risk_management (
  risk_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  test_id INT,
  risk_type VARCHAR(50),
  risk_level INT,
  FOREIGN KEY (test_id) REFERENCES stress_tests(test_id)
);

CREATE TABLE StressTests (
  test_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  test_name VARCHAR(255),
  test_duration INT,
  test_result VARCHAR(50)
)

CREATE TABLE RiskFactors (
  factor_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  factor_name VARCHAR(255),
  factor_weight FLOAT,
  factor_description TEXT
)

CREATE TABLE TestResults (
  result_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  test_id INT,
  factor_id INT,
  result_value FLOAT,
  result_date DATE
)

CREATE TABLE RiskAssessments (
    assessment_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    test_id INT,
    scenario_id INT,
    factor_id INT,
    assessment_result DECIMAL(10, 2),
    FOREIGN KEY (test_id) REFERENCES StressTests(test_id),
    FOREIGN KEY (scenario_id) REFERENCES TestScenarios(scenario_id),
    FOREIGN KEY (factor_id) REFERENCES RiskFactors(factor_id)
);
CREATE TABLE stress_test_scenario (scenario_id INT PRIMARY KEY, scenario_name TEXT, stress_level INT, risk_factor FLOAT)
